Oh children, I have given you this book, which is the final work of medical science, to complete its purpose in life, and to expose its theories and declarations, I think it is necessary for you to master this treatise, which is part of surgical art.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art. The text means: "For I have seen a doctor foolish and ignorant who caused an epistaxis (nosebleed) in a woman's throat, and cut some arteries in the throat so that great blood flowed into the woman until she died among the rest of her family.

I saw another doctor who was receiving stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and even went to a blacksmith who had fractured the bone in his crotch; and despite the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and pins under great tension, and did not leave the wound breathless.

In the caudal and dry area with a material that desiccates; for some say that cautery is suitable for it, and others disagree, saying that cautery is not convenient in such illness, which is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and therefore is inconvenient that the caudal and dry area be so that the cautery and dry should heal the disease.

E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument. E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cauterization is convenient in all times, because the damage caused by time's accident is absorbed in the youth of this that is carried away with the cauterization, and more so if the cauterization is for painful or necessary pains, strong and persistent ones, which do not tolerate delay, so that they are feared by those who bring evil, which is greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	It is not contained in your body, or children, this is only believed by the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that there is a disease cured with cautery is not always true, and they pause that consequence.

The cause is not that it comes from the blood which flows through this place, because cautery is only in place of medicine which alters the composition and dries out the humidity that are the cause for the pain to come.

E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that its disease may return in some hour of the time, according to the composition of the disease and the location of its malady, and the virtue of it, and thus because it is prepared in the body of him through the addition of unnecessary things to him, and thus it is conveyed to him in his acquisition of foods and similitudes of those causes; unless that the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a member with few unnecessary things and humors, as for example cauteri of tooth for pain and resemblance to it, possibly it does not return that pain, but rather this is done in small points.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	It is the last resort of medicine, and it is considered the most effective, not because I do not understand it in you, for those who believe that there is no cure that improves with medicine or another cause.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is in opposition to that; and I understand that the last resort of medicine is not but when administering various methods of cure for certain illnesses, those medicines not being effective, and thus at the end of the cause, administering cauterization, and improving it.

They said that the place of cauterization does not cause harm, as it is not absolutely true, because I already know how to do it and have tried it, and I claim that it is better than iron, as they said; however, when you make cauterization with gold fire, it is not at all your declared method, for it depends on the quantity you want to apply by the hardness of the gold, and how you prepare to receive burns; and if you apply pressure on the burning gold, then the gold fuses into the fire, and cases some thin plates in order for the artisan to catch upon its occupation.

De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for head pain caused by coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery is applied to the cold and humid condition on the surface of the accident from which there are two causes, namely, because of acidity and many a traumatic flux, called corissa, that flows from the head down to the feet and ears, and many sleepings, and toothaches and gouty pains, and universally all disease that comes by coldness, just as if it were paralysis, acidity, and apoplexy, and similar in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first of all, it commands the patient to evacuate his body with laxative medicine, and to apply to the head, three or four nights a day, according to the virtue of the disease, the age of the patient, and their custom.

E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	 Place your hand on the spot just before the border, and press hard enough so that the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Apply the remedy for the location with antimony until healing occurs.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	They say that when the plague leaves its mark, it is better to apply geta (a type of poultice or ointment) on the arm, because it is more nourishing and healing.

E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And let it be reduced to the state where the bone is hardened, and then cure.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They say that the cautery should penetrate to the tendon, until it presses against the bone with great force into the bone, and this is the form of aplastic petion:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They consider that from that place expire the vapors of the head.

When the blood flows from an artery that is constricted, it is not possible to pass through those narrowings, and even more so when the artery is large, unless one of four things happens: either with cauterization as they say we have, or without extraction which is not done, because when it is extracted, the extremities of him are burned and the flow is restricted, or that he be bound with a tie or a ligature by strong compression, or that his limbs be laid on medicines from which it is believed to restrict the flow; and these are strengthened with a pillow and constriction suitable.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who binds him with suitable restraint and compression of the cloth or by position, does not comfort him unless it is true.

But if this is the case, and he has not a doctor present or medicine, then he works in pause of that said word over the opening of that vein as they have said, and understands to great constriction of him inside where the flow is stopped from the main part of the plague, and on the artery, let it be not relapsed; and if on the artery some abrasion with a rough coldness be applied so that the flow is constricted and engorged; and may possibly be in need of cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	The text begins a new part.

e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat. Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.

Capitol .iii.	Chapter three.

When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is how the cautery should be made:

que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	Which is from the part between the temples to the second incision.

Capitol .v.	No translation needed, it seems to be a punctuation mark.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment of hemorrhoids by catharsis and the oils descending from the parts cut off from the head.

E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the better cure for those who have this is that you command the patient to rub his face, and make an incision in him at the middle of the forehead, a small one due to its latitude (and begins by opening the temple on the left side into the right temple; and the incision through the bone; and stretch your hand from the temples, which are swollen because of mastication), until the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	The liquid of the entire body dries out or hardens on the skin or cloth, and then place it between the two lips of the wound in the old age or cloth.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Appoint a powder in the middle to be applied in wine and oil, so that it does not develop an apostemotic caut.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	When this happens and the apostema is diminished, then cover that the bone is inside where it starts in the flesh, and apply that curative regimen dryness, which makes the flesh to look like if you took two parts of wheat flour and four parts of lead, mix them or, and make an emplastrum from these, and apply it on these flesh wounds as if they were born of flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Section VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of what is applied to the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the causes that are applied to the ears are one of four kinds: either it is like a mineral substance or similar in nature to one, such as iron and vinegar, or it is from a plant, such as poppy or fava, or it is a fluid cause, like water and wine, with its similarity, or any beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio. E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forgotten with gestic, but not; then provide extraction of him with one subtle stroke of wooden duplication.

And the way to cut that is that you first treat the patient's septic vein and drain the wound according to the manner of virtue of it, and place your hand between your fingers and convert the armpit to the parts below, and make a small fissure in the root of the armpit with the gray color of it in the previous location.

e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	Administer the excision of that fat which has fallen into the earshell.

Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of cure for itching in the armpits.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	There are some instances where a young child sucks from the belly of its nurse who has not pierced it, and this happens to many people, itching in the meat of the armpit due to plague or for no reason at all in that area; and sometimes this itching occurs on the underside of the arm's fold which they did not know about, and sometimes on the outside parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	The part of the body that is most affected by the patient's condition cannot be understood by observation alone.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	In that part where it is possible to understand the movement, you should pause the forehead of the patient in sunlight and observe carefully.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if opposition is evident, then use that subtle instrument of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of him in which is small latitude, one part being acute and the other not; and the instrument has two sharp edges so that it does not cause pain on the forehead.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the opacity is due to a flesh wound on the forehead or on the skin of him, then use that subtle instrument many times and apply that forceful facility until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if opacity is in the forehead area, then take a subtle sharp instrument and apply heat to that part for a little while, and place it on the skin of the forehead.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you sense that the oppression is caused by the weight of the disease, applying force to lift it with ease, be careful not to strain the nerves of the forehead.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	He joined the wound with Egyptian linen in the second layer according to the quantity of the swelling of the torn flesh which you have wrapped around it. And do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the plague; or take some balm and put that into the open area, and sprinkle on it a threefold mixture, using the one; and if the armpit is already inflamed, then cover with hot oil that you may crush that balm and mix it with another balm which you wrapped around in cerot so that it may be made of olive resin, until the inflammation subsides.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If the bleeding occurs from a wound, then submerge a sponge or linen in water and press it on the armpit, and use another treatment which constricts the flow of blood, as mentioned in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the cure for athezia, which affects the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athesia which affects the eyelids of those with whitening skin, some are moist and some dry.

E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is to close the incisions and the wounds that have become visible again when there is still some cause left in them; and when they are cauterized with fire, those wounds are burned up and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	The end of the document.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for swelling that occurs in the eyelids of children.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Old warts that grow in the eyelids of children which have no cause and are assembled into giant size in strength and hardness, and for this giant size they are called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of great humidity in the eyelid, above and below.

E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the figure is large, then you will adjust it with a suture, and care for it until it heals.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it's small, then you won't suffer much from that, because the blood restores and heals it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the size is decreasing towards the parts of the eyelid, then you will cover the surface of those parts, because that's the eye and suspend the size with oil, other than what you suspect from the beginning, press on that whole part, and if the eyelid by beginning is stretched, it won't notice any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Then apply the beginning, wash the eyelid with salted water; and care for that place with that which heals until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Capitol chapter 1.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	About the treatment of ulcers on the eyelid above.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Ulcers that are born in the tunics of the eyelid above, especially in children, worsen their ulcers and lead to their complete destruction; and because they cannot endure the brightness of the sun, they are overwhelmed with pain.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels. And there is no way of operation on one who is suffering from the disease, where he places his head in your hands, and you place a cloth of linen and wool, and you make a circle according to the amount of arthronach that contains all the pain, and you press on it with your fingers all over so that there is swelling in the middle of the circle, and then put on the middle of that humidity with a spatulum incident at the fissure, so that the fissure is not greater than the one made in flabbotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca. E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to adjust the fissure, lest you go on to the heel and hurt yourself with the splint.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not come upon the arnach in the beginning of the fissure, but rather adjust it with a small ease inside as you process the arnach; and cut off that ass which we have mentioned; and place draps of linen soaked in water, vinegar, and powder on the spot and stretch those on.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And thus to cure, sprinkle salt and place it in the cavity of the fissure so that it may be cleansed of that remaining moisture.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And thus treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	It happens in the same place where the cautery was applied, otherwise the cure is delayed until it heals.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 61.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the various ways of touching the foot.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the skin around the foot is scratched by the hair, those parts are rubbed natural and turned old, otherwise they cause pain in the foot and lead to various illnesses such as excessive tearing, softening of eyelids and tissues inside, causing destruction of the foot that requires touching the foot, and cure is done in four ways: either by applying a cauterized flame; or by an acute medicine according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization; or through a cut and suture technique; or with canes as you said.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore it is known that you must pause the head of the disease in your hand; turn back the eyelid of the foot with your left hand, and if it turns, good! If not, insert a needle into that part where the hair is coming from below the lid, and penetrate the needle through the hair, and let it come out — close to the edge of the eyelid where you see the hairs — close to the hairs, and pull the thread to the parts under the lid, and turn it with the ray.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	It is necessary to make an incision at the beginning of the eyelid's outer corner, adjusting the furrows of those eyelashes so that they are insistent on the lateral part of the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor; and you should extract the membrane and pause those small fluff-like particles of cotton or wool under the eyelid, and fix them over the eyelid with a thread, in such a manner as if it were like a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, it is assumed that the figure will be according to the quantity of eyelash thickness, as this has varied among men, where those for whom it should be inserted a large amount into the lower part of the eyelid according to how much the eyelid becomes softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Make an incision along the two lines that you have marked, and start from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	If your incision is like the natural split of the eyelashes, as it is as large as the king's thickness.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And apply the ointment in one of the two angles of the codena, and remove that whole; adjust both lips with the scripture against the gum or fine thread of wool, and scrub away the salve, and attach whatever surplus threads of yarn to two eyebrows at certain conditions, if you wish, and otherwise do not cure.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	If the wound of the fleshes has healed within three days or four, and if you cure it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	If you wish, let the plague heal its sutures, and cure that which is dry and constricted, because when the eyelid is swollen, seal off the plague and add it; but suture is better, therefore do thus the old ways of treating.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But in it also there is some solicitude about the illness, and this is a good operation, and not out of fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And it is another way to treat, and it is that the figure on the eyelid resembles an olive leaf, and so raise the eyelid with three fingers separated and gathered in this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if this is not possible, hold the fingers, and so take an arrow with feathers in it and insert it into the middle of the figure, and pass the other arrow close to the lacrimal major, and then the second one close to the smaller lacrimal, adjust between the two of them the arrows with equality, and place your hand on top of them with elevation equal, elevate all the head upon which is seen this image as we have recounted.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Close the two lips of the wound with stitches, and cure the inside so that it heals.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess occurs because of a cut or a fracture, then treat the abscess with cerotes and like pus.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the eyelid is turned inward towards the eye itself, so that you may use in that case what has been said about stitching; but stitch only where it seems natural.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Tie the canes together according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And so you convert the eyelid and cut out the figure as it is described; and tie two canes or thin needles, whose length is according to the length of the eyelid and its breadth not more than the breadth of the spoon.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already stitched in the extremities of those parts where you have sewn the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	And accordingly, add as much subtlety over the part of the eyelid of the eye, and tie the canes of those parts with a strong but gentle structure, so that the cord may die and be denied for at least three days, until it falls in due time by itself.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	If it's delayed, then break the stone on the thigh, and apply treatment to the wound before it becomes healthy.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	But when it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and there's no itching on the skin.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is how you will make two canes, which you must follow this form.
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and has the same quantity of length and breadth neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	On the elevation of itchy skin on the sole of the foot, when the skin is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the skin is unnatural, hard and prickly, with painful soles, then the operation in it is that you take a subtle needle and puncture in that subtle fold, and adjust its extremities so that they do not become stuck in that manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And if the length of the folds is equal to the span of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And also place another subtle fold in it briefly, and tighten the extremities of that one if you want.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And return the patient's head to its place in your hand, and make it as warm as possible so that your work may be declared, for this is a subtle and small operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And introduce the needle into the tight skin of the groin area, which has been constricted, and make it penetrate through the eyelid rapidly as you extract it from its natural place.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And pull the groin area under and introduce it into the ligature, taking one or two hairs at most.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And pull your hand into the space, so that the skin may be tightened around the ligature in the eyelid, as it is in its natural place.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if the ligature is tightened and not the skin, then tighten the ligature to the parts left under, on the tendon which you have sewn together, so that it may be tightened over the remaining part.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And leave it there until the heel is visible, for as long as you tighten the ligature and sew it, and pull tight on what remains of the heel, and allow it to heal for two or three days before it adheres to its proper place and begins to form a healthy flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	If the belly is shorter, then you will adjust a longer pellicle (hair) of natural hairs, and raise it up, or so that it doesn't get in until it's stretched to some space, and then you will raise that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	From the treatment of which he sees in the eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When he sees in the eye an ulceration, and it is contraction of the eyelid which is contracted towards its side, either to the right or left, due to poor healing of wound or of ulcers or cauterization, and this is called leporina, and this ulceration is done either by natural means or accidental, and is caused by poor healing of wound or ulcers or cauterization, or resembling them in their bad condition.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of the operation is that you split that consolidation and separate its lips, and put a dressing in it where there is between those two things a kind of fabric made of linen, and tie them together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And it is not covered that you use a cure of him from the causes which dry out, constricting; for if you do this, it will return to ulcerate worse than before, with no time having passed.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use that remedy in cases where mollification is necessary as it is for gout, and apply the water to which are added the seeds of fenugreek, or a mixture of dayquil, liquefied with some oil, in which I should immerse myself and cure.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of my cure is that you pierce all the vein that is not yet consolidated in the form as I did at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said is nothing but a correction of an excessive cauterization that does not return the form to the place as it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	On the cure of cauterization which is done on the eyelid, some.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This cauterization which is done on the eyelid, which is truly called cauterization, and is either of natural or accidental origin.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But it is accidental in cases of plague, fracture, or cauterization, or other similar causes.

The operation of the patient is that you take a needle with double thread, and put it in the flesh, and make the fassas pass from the left lacrimal into the right lacrimal, until the thread reaches both extremities of the flesh.

And this is the angle of the two fissures at each end of the incision, which you have made where they converge, and so make an angle on them when they come together, making a figure of their meeting.

Adjust the separated parts and sew them with wool thread, and cure those as they have said of mollifying medicines and calques inside until it is healed.

If you apply oil to a wound or incision or cautery, then cover that as a flat wound over the skin of the eyelid according to what has been predecided.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Separate with calgua between two labia as they have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the end of the discourse on the treatment of applying oil when it is dried up or discarded, as soon as possible in the operation, according to what has been prepared in the form of applying oil, and that is in the form of diverse motes.

And the artisan knows all the time how to prepare in any way possible that which is possible for him to bring back the figure to its natural form or near it, and that patient according to what he suits of the operation and instruments in the major disposition.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	On the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs in the eyes of men, so that it is solidified to the eyelid, and above it is bound by the album of the nail, and restricted from the facility of movement and its natural works, therefore know that you will enter the extremity of the ray through the eyelid, and lift it up there, or extend it with a finger in the navel.

And you will insert the attachment with a subtle instrument, which should not be sharp, because the incisions are obtuse, so as not to disturb the patient during the operation, and return the spatula that does not affect the nail.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	The starting point of the nail and the elevation of skin around the lacrimal gland.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Be aware that the nail is either nervous (i.e. split) or not nervous (i.e. similar to dry white skin), and if you touch it with your finger, it will take a drop of water off, and if the drop does not stick to it, it is broken and will not adhere again.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	Both kinds do not feed on the greater lacrimal, but rather the smaller one that gradually covers the eye and prevents light and movement.

And you take a needle and insert it into one of a horse's or a boar's or a cow's hoof, or something similar, or a strong thread, and duplicate the extremity of the needle slowly and fix it in the middle of the nail, then penetrate with the needle and tie to the nail with a cord, and extend it to the separated parts, and excoriate with the razor the flesh just below the nail, which will clear the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And you follow that method around the belly to the end of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And you carefully inscribe the remaining parts in the lower part of the eye socket, using a thin stick or small forks, and cut away the flesh of the natural tear duct to avoid getting constant flows of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And some say that the wing of an eagle is spread out or in feathers, thus this is how they claim it should be:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And watch that you do not touch the corneal covering with the stick, lest there be rupture and the pupil should become perforated.

And carefully put some salt crushed or made from powdered chief (or sinaw?) into the heel, and cut it up into the other part; and treat that with water so that it may heal within.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the eye is not numb and you cannot insert the needle, nor can it be fixed in that lower socket, then many times this type of eye is cured with medicines, and it is healed thus as I have said and written in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	If you want to cut that one open, then first open the patient's belly and take a sharp spoon of fine steel in order to cut according to this form.
am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if that thing is rarefied and is concealed and poured into that place, then draw from your mouth on the forehead made of sinew or on the head with rose oil or salt crushed three times, and pour the forehead into the other day.

E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And if the wire is in such subtlety and roughness according to the quantity that can fit between the teeth; and the shape of the ring is that you take the wire and insert twice its length between two sound teeth, and place it so that as you grow with both twists of the wire between the two jaws, or if there's one or a little bit, until the fabric reaches the healthy tooth of the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	It appears to be saying: "Now return the tissue into the part from which you began, and tighten your hand with facility and wisdom so that it is not torn.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	It appears to be saying: "So it is the tightness of your ligament which you must tighten, from which will arise the reason of the teeth that do not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	It appears to be saying: "And remove the superfluous ends of the ligament with forceps or scissors, and place those in any location you wish, convert them and turn them between the healthy tooth and the diseased one, so that it does not harm the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	It appears to be saying: "And cut off that straight axis with a Roman blade.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	It appears to be saying: "But if it is unwound or torn, tighten that or those with another ligament in such a manner for all its time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	It appears to be saying: "And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and two diseased ones, as such these are linked:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	It appears to be saying: "And when one returns a tooth or two in the space of its place, and they are grown back as if they were counted, and that they renew.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	It's performed by skilled artisans and wise men.

This ligament which feels the tongue sometimes or is natural and to which one pays attention, or accidental and occurs when a plague that has already set in strikes it.

Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Removal of pus attached to the groin.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When treating the pus with that which has been said in the division of the wound and medicines, but do not give comfort, consider placing the patient's groin area to the sun, so that you can compress the tongue with an instrument for which you have noted.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	So if you cut the pus, remove that and extract it with one small ounce or gentle movements.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	If it's not possible to extract it, then take a concave tube and insert that into the patient's groin area, place a red-hot iron in the concavity of the tube, and do so as long as the pus is dead and falls off the groin; and abstain from giving the patient water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And take a cloth full of water, wipe the mouth with it, and wash the mouth with it; and do not let any cause or pain arise from that, but let the water sit on her for an hour another time, as soon as the pus can feel the water cold.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	Mouth is forgotten where there are records, the patient has been covered in vinegar or asafoetida by the instrument used for recording at the suffumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	This too, where it is found.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And it is another manner of operation in the suffumigation of that thing, where you take a sheet with carbon and igniting carbons covered with a cloth, so that the sheet is filled with the instrument; and you allow it to descend; and you place the patient's mouth at the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the suffumigation does not get forgotten until you know that the suffumigation has reached the sanguisuga, where the sanguisuga will soon come.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	But if it does not come, then you will repeat the suffumigation several times, and abstain from giving the patient food or drink, and only give them salty foods and ashes, and do not offer water, and so that this regimen be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the gallbladder juice of the gouty patient is drawn when seen; and it is similar to forceps as often, but not when there is any curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the gouty, and its extremity is similar to the beak of a stork, which is a good thing, in which it is sharpened with lime, so that when any cause comes into contact, it will not sting.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which the sum is of the sentence in observation of ulcers, and in section of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The ulcers are small special ones, of varying motions, as remembered of them, from each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of them by two motions, one of which is by the special motion of ulcers themselves; and also because of how we compress from humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second motion is proper to the places in which accidents of the body occur, where an ulcer occurs in the head is different from one that occurs in the anus; and the ulcer in the meaty place occurs differently from one in a joint; and each has its own nature for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	The pain from apostemas (wartles) can only be covered up but not perforated until the healing of the sickness or completion of their treatment.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other warts that can be treated when they are crossed over, and not maturing according to their completion, are such that when the wart is located near a joint, it causes prolongation until you treat what is in its circuit, and these are very painful because they corrupt the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of that member; or if it's on a main limb, and if you delay perforating it until it matures over the main limb; or if it's on the rectum, therefore perforate that one which is not mature; and do not attempt to treat the raw wart, but only the one which is near the rectal area, so that it does not bring discomfort and become elongated at the entrances of the rectum, causing a fistula.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	You can know when to pierce the wart only if you have understood its maturity.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	You know that the wart is mature when there is drying of the pain and cessation of fever, and approach the decrease of swelling and pulse, and the sharpness of the wart's head, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And when you know how to pierce accurately in the place where the swelling and pus are coming from, after the incision.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And if you pierce through the length of the flesh or body, when swellings are in the armpits or feet, and around the joints, tendons, nerves, arteries; and, finally, in all those places that have no reflection; but in those where reflections occur, use piercing according to the affected limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But if the swelling is in the flesh, then be careful to pierce into it until it confirms itself according to its nature; as they have said; because if you pierce that part first, the course of the bowel and mucus will be prolonged, and the softness of the lips will be increased, and the depth of the wound.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But swellings in the size of the skin or body require piercing according to its latitude, or according to that which requires the part.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you can administer a small piercing, and in large swellings a larger piercing, and one that is narrow or many small ones according to the diversity of the size of the swellings.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other cases of abscesses in which the cord is conquered and inflamed, when it is done as you said to put on a pan and do it in the place where there is already a stain, like that which occurs in tropics of duodenal fever and bubonic.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those where there is an infection in a section that has three angles, and where it is infected as if with a shape like the leaf of myrrh, just as are the abscesses of the angles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And in these cases where round section and lunar section are administered, and are similar to them.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But he to whom there is no such case as the superficial abscesses of the lions, you can penetrate him with a superficial or flat perforation alone.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And if the abscess is large and has already accumulated a lot of pus, you penetrate it but do not extract all the purulent fluid at that time; instead, take out one part, place the wound closed on the following day, and then take out another larger part, and place it in the same manner as before, until it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	If the malady is caused by excess cold virtue, or a woman in labor, or an infant small, or an old person in decline, when the animal spirit moves and is resolved through the exit of the disease, and weighs heavily on the moribund body, you open it.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Be cautious when guarding this chapter, and carefully open the incision in which you make this perforation, wherever you cleanse yourself of the plague, considering whether the plague of the appendix is small or flat, then you administer the remedies for it or for the side; if the appendix is large, and the fissures of the perforation are scattered, therefore be cautious to make a passage in between until they coalesce.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If there is a tear or a hollowing out of the tendon or a concavity in the appendix, then carefully wrap that up with old rags or bandages, like when you wrap up papyrus or linen; and bind it strongly for three days; and process it further so that it may be cured with ointments that cure coughs until the disease is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if a flow of blood occurs in the hour of your operation, then you administer vinegar and wine mixed with linen rags; and place that over the location of the flowing blood as soon as it becomes visible.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the flow of the sickness persists, then be sure to administer regimen and cure, and apply powders which I have recommended in various places of this book and on divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the time of winter, and the place of the abscess is among the nerves, then be sure to pour powder into the vein and oil caut, and apply those on the places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	But if it is in summer, and the places are fleshy, then be sure to pour powder with honey water or oil into the vein and oil, and apply everything so that it is pressed for three days, as they have said, and then be sure to remove the abscess and clean it, and administer the cure accordingly, as it suits him, until he is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the universal cure for abscesses, but according to the way of distinction which I have already said about all abscesses in which manner it should be cured, particularly by head.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	A joint or swelling in the neck region occurs.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	There are small swellings in the neck region, which are of a special kind of nodules that contain a covering membrane, and are also called by different names.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they have pus, and those contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And those contain humidity similar to milk, and resembling them; and those are stony-hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in general, and during the extraction of those, there is no fear, but rather, as one would expect, does not cause arthritis.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you apply those with an instrument having the shape which you approach to it, called "entromes", though you knew what it contained.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Where this is liquid, you then cut it apart with that section according to its length, by sectioning it superficially according to that shape.
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begins in the section from line B to line G. Then, as soon as the liquid is evacuated, you scrape off that part which contained that liquid, and do not neglect any other cause of all, for if some residue has been seen to return, then there remains some other cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	If necessary, soak the affected area in Egyptian water (if present), and if not, in water and salt; fill it with that and lay the wound inside on another day, until it is entirely corroded through to the underlying membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Subsequently iterate over that area with Egyptian water secondarily and subsequently if desired, until it is completely clear that there is no underlying cause for the membrane, then treat the wound with the eye inside until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	If there are swollen nodules, then you cut them in this manner:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	Cut in a crosswise section, and press an onion once between the two lips of the section, cutting through it completely, and exert force to extract the skin that contains the.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if it is in opposition to your bow (or arrow), then do this thing first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Do the same thing to the hardened, swollen area of the section and the wound, as you have said; cutting through the swollen area is lighter, because it has less scar tissue and less humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	Some worms are found in the head of which only a few are humid; this is because you cut open an apostema on a woman's head and attached it to a hard, white, blanched skin, which could not be drunk, and if anyone touched that, they would be hurt.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other wounds on the head, this does not apply, as if the worms that come to the heads of children, and for this reason the auriculas; but the section of these is all surface section.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	Pause the perforation of those from the lower end of their passage, so that relief is given to the body of the sick at the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And cure those with this, because it suits the art of healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofulae which occur in the groin.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Some are found in the groin, and also in the eyelids and in the axillary nodes; and some occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	It appears to be describing the location of a tumor or cyst. 
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	Joint pain caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body and cause pain in the feet is customarily called gout by doctors.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Then in that one, which you consider to be well-disposed by touch, the color of which is manifest and is proper to the color of the tendon, it is malignant all over, not attached to any part of the nerves, veins, or arteries, but with superficial dryness of the beginning part to the end part of the body from G (gland) to B (bone), scrape that whole part, and extend the labia of the tendon by one or two inches if necessary, as they have said in the aphorisms of the head.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful to not scrape the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, so that it does not irritate your hand upon inscribing, or disturb the patient, and only scrape what is not necessary to scrape; if you were to cut a vein or artery, stop immediately from your operation, pause on the infected wound vitriolated or other powder which obstructs the flow of blood, and extend the wound, and let it be smooth in that which remains quiet, so that the pain of the ulcer subsides and the wound becomes soft and begins to heal.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the wound is separated.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation while you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inspect the area you have just described to see if there is any other small scrofula, and insert those as well and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it's in the root of a large scrofula, cover that area so as not to insert that scrofula further into its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover so that the tissue is folded tightly and so that you insert it in such a way that it doesn't cause further damage.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And fill the wound with the Egyptian vinegar that you have already inserted into it, and cure that one.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you insert that scrofula entirely, then cover that so that the two lips of the wound are tied together and sew them tightly at once to prevent any further superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you think that there is no superfluity because of the great size of the scrofula, then cover so that you understand to insert the root of that one, extract it and sew it, as thus said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	The part of the scrofula that contains moisture perforates in this place (of maturation) and pauses its perforation so that it becomes dry at the base of the body, just as has been said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Allow the perforation to proceed and you must cut open and examine it in order to see what is inside, so that you can discover its cause of corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you think the wound has been cleansed, then cure it by cutting open the flesh within until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the section of the appendix that is caught in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	They say that this section is the appendix and that nobody in our land has seen it exist.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their saying.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men, the appendix has a fold (esquinencia) that should be avoided when extracting it, so as not to injure just those veins and major vessels of the disease which are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	May it be with those who have ulcers in the mouth or gum tissue or two gold rings, when the illness is not in the canals, they should take care of the section of epilhot to avoid the loss which is done through perforation due to perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.
