Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the section of swellings that occur by straining or through a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When straining is broken and the cord is consolidated over that area, then swollen veins often occur and the signs by which it can be known are inflammation and swelling in an artery or a vein: when the swelling occurs because of straining, it becomes long and swollen on the front of the body; and when you press on the swollen area, you feel a stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which occurs through a vein is round in the manifestation of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	This section about the swelling is an error, and especially in those places where it leaves the joints, and in the groin, and in the navel, and in other places of the body; and it is very large, therefore it can be difficult to avoid its cure through fire, and he who has it in the extremities, or on the head, should try to avoid it.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	When someone is afflicted by the swelling of the bowels due to the inflammation of the archery, you cut through the third section of the cord in length; and you separate the swellings from the artery, and deliver the tunics inside so that they are uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And place metal needles over that opening and make them penetrate into the other flesh; and tighten the artery with a double thread in two places, — which causes you to have your essence extracted from the two arteries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And punch the place which is between two ligaments with a staff, so that it may set free what is in there, and dissolve the abscess.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And administer remedy to the place where pus is generated, so that when the ligaments fall in it; and cure it by applying an ointment suitable for it, until healing occurs.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	But if the abscess is due to a section of the vein, then cover with your hand that part which is nearest to the possible location of the abscess in the cord; and insert the needle at the place where you have held your hand, and make it penetrate. And be in that thread double, as you extract from the other flesh, and tie the abscess to the two ligaments according to what I told you in the ligament of grapevine of both parts, one on each extremity of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	If you fear that the thread will be pulled out, then enter the needle into that spot, leaving the rest of the swelling behind, so as not to make a worse opening first.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	After drying the swelling in the middle of it while it is still within him, then inscribe the superficial part of the cord, and gently cut what is tied to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And place your hand over the powder that you have immersed in vinegar and oil, and administer the treatment which is done with calomel and enemas until it heals.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Cover the swelling that occurs due to a twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	It happens in cases of swelling in an artery and a vein, and similarly it occurs in the joints when they are struck or strained excessively, and to some extent.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	It is made in the middle of the foot on the locations of the assistors or the ankle, or all over the place where there are painful joints.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe swelling and it appears like the rest of the body, and in its most painful positions, it causes confusion and dementia, and one feels as if they are suffering from madness.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	There is no accumulated pus in the wound of the neck, and for this reason leave it unbound, and let him be carried to his full health and not to the parts before or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	So this is what happens to those who are in the joints and do not cover with iron, because they will eventually develop a contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But he who is in the head or on the forehead has his bandage tied with a staff.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if there is accumulated pus, then take it out from the fever and divide it with razors.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then put it under anointing oil, and excise that one, and remove the swelling, and adjust the wound with a suture, and cure that until it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the section of pus which occurs in the cheek that occurs in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Evening to the swelling of acne which is found in the bellies of those and in other parts of their body, which are called fungals due to their resemblance to fungi, whose nature is subtle and its head thick; and the lips of those who have small ones, and those who have large ones.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	I have seen one, and in its belly were two little worms that looked like fungi, and there was no difference between those white ones.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those were inward and split, and moisture was running from that whole time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	So you inserted those and attached them to one in the feet weighing about eighteen ounces, and the other weighed about six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation for their insertion is that if the patient has been wet, and the color of the flesh is white, moist, of subtle disease; then you insert them with a spatula, and they are in your presence with cauterization on the spot, where many times the section of it is expelled with salvation; and if it does not vent, cauterize that one.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is pale and fearful, guard yourself from insertion with iron; but rather take faithful action of lead newly made, and strengthen that flesh, just as they have said; and let it remain for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Adjust the thread of lead in the structure of the wire; therefore, do not cease to tighten the lead thread until it is broken and falls apart by itself, its work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the thread is of large size, therefore it is no cause of fear and terror, and more so in those who are in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	Perhaps you will cut off the majority of it, and then cauterize that part so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And treat that one until the plague is cured.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware that you do not cut the thread which is of dark color, little feeling, and thick aspect, because it is a cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And if you remember the symptom of cancer near to it.
Capitol .lii.	The end.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the treatment of the navel's excellence.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Excellence of the navel is caused by many reasons: or through fissures of the liver which is over the abdomen, and you put the cloth or cushion under it according to how deep the other ruptures are; or for an ulcer which flows from a vein or artery according to what it says, or due to blocked heat in him.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If the wound is caused by a rupture of the phlegm and the inflammation of the skin, then the color of the swelling is similar to the color of the body; and it is clear that this pain is sharp, and appear in different situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	If it is by the protrusion of the intestine, then the situation of that part will be similar to where it has previously been reported, with more violent diversity; and when you press those parts with your fingers, it is concealed, and return; and it is very light in that place, and it is magnified by the movement of bathing and intense labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by humidity, then it is sharp and not concealed when you press with your hand, nor is it compressed, nor is it closed.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	If it is by sand, then the signs appear in this way: the swelling is getting darker and declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by flesh only, then the swelling is a hard, large and thick one, fixed in a certain quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by airiness, then the touch of that part is sharp.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the prominence of the navel is due to the hernia or the tissue, then know that command the patient to hold themselves and be extended; and take a tent on the circuit of all the navel, and command him to stay between your hands over their shoulders; and take the spatum lat in the circuit of the navel on the place where you have seen the tent; and extend the size of the excrescence to the parts below by an inch large; and tie it in the circuit with a firm or soft fiber, in the manner of tying well.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Now take the middle of the extended excrescence and put your finger into that place where you want to make the hernia; and if you have touched it or looked at it through the ligament, then extract it from there, and impel the hernia into the parts below of the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	If you have touched the tissue, then take one inch from it; and inscribe the excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your art or vein, then encircle that place, and return to your operation; take two needles and insert them into those strong fibers, and put two needles in the circuit which you have made around the excrescence in a manner of crossing, so that they penetrate; and strengthen the excrescence in four parts on the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If you want, hold the needles and let your fingers feel the location where the skin is stretched and falls apart; or insert them when it is tender, and place care on that area with the balm, so that the cough may disappear into the wound.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	If the prominence of the navel is made of no flesh or dampness in it, then cough that you uncover the apostaema (appendix) as we have said and expose the stragula (a lump or mass), which attracts humors in it, and place care on that area with the balm, so that the cough subsides.
Capitol .liii.	Book 33.
De curacio de cranc.	On the cure of warts.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, of the type of wart and in which manner it comes to the cure with medicines, and what is necessary in order to prevent its ulceration; and we have also mentioned that warts are born from excess caution in the cure of them.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	They say that some warts are found in places where they can be easily eliminated, such as the one which is in the breast or under the skin similar to a member, and they pull out all that, especially when it starts small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	When it is very old and has been passed down through many generations, I do not think that it suits you because you have not been able to cure yourself of that illness or have seen anyone else who has been cured.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on you is what we have said, that you proceed and leave the illness and purge it of black bile some times, and then apply the plaster if it is severely inflamed with a marked manifestation.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And prepare the illness by preparation in which it will be located at the site of the operation, and prophesize in the tract unguents that are suitable for that; and carefully crush good senna inside to prevent any other cause from remaining within.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the wound heal quickly, and do not incise it unnecessarily, press the areas, and abstain from applying strong saffron on your hand or with any instrument that is at your disposal of those instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it has contrary effects of great saffron incision on the vein or artery, then cauterize that inside until the flow of the wound is stopped, and then treat that with another treatment until it cures.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter Title
De curacio de ydropici.	Treatment for dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recorded in the division, of the types of dropsy caused by water, and the signs of each type, from the treatment with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is not but the type of althaea alone, and it is not close to the type of tympanists nor to the type of ypo-sarkha, for this is mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this type of dropsy caused by tympanists with medicines and do not confirm your treatment, for that, consider whether the patient has already gained weakness, or if it is another illness, like ydropici, either one to be like if it's in lungs or belly pain and similar to those, then guard yourself well so that you don't treat it with iron, because there is fear about that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if the patient has ydropici alone and not another illness, except for weakness and youth, then the method of its operation is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and minister to it so that you remove the water from the passage leaving behind the spleen, and apply spatum spinos in this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It is in two acute parts, of sharp length from the body to the stump; but however it may be in some small degree less, that through the operation it does not enter into the intestine, and that both are.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And consider whether the generation of dropsy is due to the intestines, because it occurs when you cover the section that is three fingers' length from the navel inwards, towards the umbilicus.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of dropsy is due to liver disease, then your section is on the left side of the navel for three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of dropsy is due to bile, then your section is in the third part.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not cover your section on the side where you wish to locate the patient, lest the superfluities run to that location.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And appropriate perforate the entire cord with the instrument, and appropriate introduce it into that section, and lift your hand on the spatum between the cord and the sphincter, and you scrape that out; if there is only one fingernail or a little less.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And now carefully puncture the scrotum into where the pus will spread, and it is filled with water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And now carefully extract that (the affected part) into an instrument of the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is made like a fine silver cannula; it is made of silver or iron, with a small notch at the bottom, and on its sides there are three notches: two from one side and one from the other side; and the cutting edge is inserted according to the manner of plucking feathers, thus as if by snatching.
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And on the upper end of it there is an armlet, because when the instrument comes into contact with water, that same amount of time makes the person wet, therefore evacuate from the water in the middle quantity, whatever if you evacuate more or less than that, for if you evacuate too much then it doesn't fit in the hour, and the person will suffer greatly by death for solution of their spirit animal, or else it happens to him a five wounds that is approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	May evacuate from that according to the quantity of his virtue, and according to what they signify to you the dispositions of the patient's virtue, with the virtue of his pulse, and the goodness of him.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Extract the instrument, and retrieve the water that is held back by the cord which prevents the passage of the tract that is on top of the cipha (or hip) which you count and mark to oneself in such a manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	Repeat the instrument on another day if necessary because the patient tolerates it well, and extract a small quantity of water, and have that done for about 5 days before temperature, and be careful so that it does not break off into the water but very little.

Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	The penis in women is rarely born.

Capitol lxii.	Chapter Sixty-two.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the treatment of hernias.

De castracio.	Castration.

E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore say that castration is performed in two ways: either by cutting or by division of the section.

E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	The cure for it is to stretch and incise that one, or that you scratch that with a needle or through the skin where it fits.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	If you wish, cauterize that, as has been said, with fire or with sharp medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And you have already eradicated both the inner and outer sides with the instrument which you told me.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	It is a small prominence or fistulous cavity with a yellowish or reddish appearance on the surface of the body, and when it touches (the area), it is painful for about 30 centimeters, resembling an ant bite, and this is a false inflammation.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	The translated line is:
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	If you wish, do this by inserting a cannula of horn or iron in that way:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	So that the passage of the cannula from above leaves no sensitivity, no sound (it is not perforated), wrapped so that over it there is no feeling and no convulsion of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	If you wish to cauterize the wound according to what is said in the procedure of aethers, as described in the chapter on cautery.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	According to the form of the instruments that are administered to cause perforation.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes the perforation is made with silver or lead, melted or hammered; and sometimes it is done with those small instruments as well as large ones, according to which are administered, so that the one who administers the treatment of little children's small wounds is also small, and of those whose buttocks are painful or ulcerated, their perforations are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The large perforation is rare.
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The top of the cannula from above, in which the bag is tied, is wide in this manner; and there is distinction at that place where the bag is tied, just as if it were happening sometimes.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And when the extremity of it was placed inside the fundament, which is not swollen (so is not an inflammation), then again to subtlety; and in one of its skin's latz (folds) there are two tracks, and in the other side one track, and the size of the track according to the largeness of the rays and the bigger it is, the smaller a little.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And it is the bag in which the medicines of beast's bladder or wool are placed, and its size is one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it is perforated by two tracks as it was turned around, and if the space between the tracks has a size of the said thing.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And you enter into those tracks with a piece of cord fastened to a cord of flesh that is of twelve pieces, or through them; and adjust the bag; and when it is placed there, the bag is straight at the top of the cristeri between two distinct ones very tight, and you put a cristeriza on each track: But the quality of putting cristeriza on each one is that you tie the bag with the medicine so that it is scalded according to the quantity of the patient's tolerance; and be careful that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	The translation is:
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	If the medicine fails to cure him, hold on as long as you can; and if he sleeps on that bed for a whole night, it is worse in the morning.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you pierce him in the diseases of the stomach and the incision of his intestines, always go through with the cautery until he is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	If in the rectum there are bleeding or pus-filled appendages, then pierce it with a subtle needle and like the other needles that children use for diagnosis.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And you have said in the division of wound treatment that it is fitting for a free man, and I say so: the treatment of those wounds with my hands and with medicines according to the custom.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	So I say that wounds are diversified according to how they occur and according to the place where the wound falls.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which wounds occur are thus: from a fall onto a stone, or from an incision in space or flesh, or percussion by lance, or by fist, or by arrow, or similar to those of such causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	Pains that occur in the parts of the body are like pains that afflict the head, or the neck, or the foot, or the belly, or the groin, and are similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	But I recommend the treatment of some pains in order to leave that reasoning and rule for other pains.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	I will start with the pains of the head that are simple, because the memory of the composed compositions will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore when it happens in the head, a simple pain and not a fracture, one considers: if it is due to a fall or similar, and the chain has already broken only once and it's a great pain and fears about that malediction of apostema, then you put on the coquette and flebotoma the cephalic so soon, and don't delay; and extract with that sanc according to the quantity of the virtue of the plague if there is no other cause prohibiting flebotomia, more especially when the sanc which is drawn out from the pain is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And flebotomy is the opposite of the departure of the painful part; and one must keep away from putrefaction and from urine and from coarse food.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	The text means: But if it is forbidden to make a small incision, then the wound should be reduced and not approach meat or flesh.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	The text means: And pause on the ulcer, if it happens that an apothecary cauterizes, cuts into olive oil-soaked cloth or wine in which it is infected.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	The text means: But if it is secure from the apothecary's cauterization, then pause over the ulcer, if it is recent and the air has not changed that powder which I recommend applying a little.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	The text means: And if the air has already changed that, then pause on an acute cough until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	The text means: But if the ulcer is large or due to space and shape, and the lips are not closed properly for ulcers, then close those with stitches as I recommend for their stitch.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	The text means: But if the ulcer has already exposed bone and skin, and it is not retention but a small suspension, then incise that one and treat the ulcer with medicines and restore the flesh in place of contraction, and command the patient to eat foods in which is grossness: caps, forms, and shapes like theirs, until they are composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	If you see corruption in the tendon and it does not adhere to the bone, then you should immerse all of this into fire and put it out.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flows and it cannot be cut with medicines, then you should inquire about the artery, and if you see that one that has not been cut, then cut that with a spatula, or ligate it; and if it necessitates, that you do not confirm what we have said, then cauterize it while the wound is open.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	If these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light; thus you should powder over those with that powder, until the air solidifies those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The method of the powder is this: prepare oil from a broken asafoetida, two parts of powdered dragon's blood, and three parts of caustic substance cut off; all mixed together thoroughly and crushed, so that when applied to the wound, it is filled, constricted by good constriction, and coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	Appropriate the lower part of the body with powder and lye, and do not remove it while it is still in this state, for it will not be infected, as it has not been treated by medicine yet that makes it sound.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	There is no cure for this alone, when I am not in your presence and do not heal the patient with dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	I already performed this operation on great wounds when it is necessary to stop them and make them straight, and on recently occurring wounds that have not yet been altered by their environment.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	If the environment has altered them and more so in summer times, then I do not understand the position of that powder, but rather treat those with it as described, thereby placing my hand on those wet spots or on the dust of wheat flour mixed with water and honey until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if it happens that the plague breaks a bone and it is small, then I extract this from gesture.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	I'm unable to complete that request.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the diseases of the bowels.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the plague occurs in the bowels, it is not different from the plague of the head in terms of treatment, and between the plague of the head which is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the bowels are crushed or the artery, then it is not the nerve, because to treat it with that will cause violent stipticitas, as is said that is vitriol and resembles the damage to the nerves and counteract that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not treat any plague with cold treatment, because the substance of the nerves is cold and its continuation is in the brain, which is the most evil of all parts.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if this is treated with lighter medicines, just as it is washed with lukewarm water, some oil (raw or scented) is applied, and thus when it is washed with lukewarm water and the other parts are touched in that manner, and moistened.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	The text means: If the wound is large, then administer stitches, or tighten the lips of the patient, and place healing powder inside until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	If the wound has great depth or occurs with pus that comes out badly, then immediately perforate it in the deeper part.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	If the wound already has cut an artery and there is a great flow of blood, then either separate or dry up that one, or tie that one, or cauterize that one if necessary, causing this.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If the spondylitis of the vertebrae or all are already cut, and you have saved the veins from the neck, then immediately adjust the ligaments of the cordon with stitches on the hollow of the vertebra, and do not touch that one; then bend equal that one and return it to its natural shape, and appropriate that one with a decent stretch, and let it heal for acutum days; and cure that one with ointment in which there is stipticitat and excitacio until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the wound has already penetrated into the bone, then immediately percuss it, and if in that place there are fragments of bone, extract all that you can from them; and if what is not suited to your body, let it heal inside until the wound dries up, and is separated, and the excrement of him is alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	If the wound is recent, then sprinkle powder over that powder which you have recommended.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if the wound has formed a fistula, then cure that with water from which you will remember that it comes about in his capital.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	From the wounds of the neck or similar, when it is caused between the shoulder blades and occurs with a space, a cut, or a lance wound, or similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a lance or spear wound and how many times its depth, then because of the plague's ventilation when the patient coughs; therefore, you know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	If it is not the depth and the wound is recent to his health, then you place in him powder at the first hour, and not strongly against that so as not to retain the health in the depth of him and so return to the heart and that alleviate the illness; but pause in him something attractive to drink twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	If the drink is not at your hand, then you pause in the orifice of the wound cut deeply so that it sucks up what is from the humidity; and make the illness sleep on the wound so that the blood runs out in a tight place.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the patient's cure is denied, and it has been open for a long time, then you will know that it was already created fistula; therefore treat that for his capital.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	If the plague is due to a cut in the space or in the toenail, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or nail, then cure that with what preceded by suture, if large, or with powder, if small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has already become inflamed in the bone, and there are already cut nails of that kind, then you will torque the plague and extract those nails, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separate, then you will lance the ones where the plague spreads, because the extraction of their contents will be alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And as for the other accidental plagues in the other members, the earliest treatment is what we have previously discussed.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of stomach plagues.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indigestion which occurs in the belly is either great, or little, or intermittent.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	There is something that sticks out or protrudes from the body due to previous surgeries or injuries of the intestine or nerve, so it's necessary to make an incision into them and sew them together more forcefully and subtly.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small disruption is made difficult to repair in another way, and it's certain that the reduction of theirs is even more difficult, unless you go back into their location immediately, because they are swollen and it makes it hard for the intervention.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is incision, because in that it's not difficult to reduce the intestine, as it is in the two other species mentioned.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	You know that the wound of the abdomen is treated in four ways, but two of them are common and convenient for wounds of other parts of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other special sutures are common to other wounds, but they are however more specific to the abdominal wound.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend that I expose and declare each of these methods.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	So I say that when the wound is small and there is no apparent cause for the intestine to bulge up because of it, and it's difficult to reduce that one, then this is done in one of two ways: either by virtue of its smallness as we have said, or when the intestine has come back due to inflammation caused by cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And when this is the case, then you must cover that person who has fallen ill with a sponge soaked in water or wine, and you must submerge them in the sea or a spring to allow the inflammation to be resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes I have seen this done where there is a skin wound, and it is better to use water alone in resolving the inflammation.

E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And cover him with linen from all parts so that it does not touch the wound area, and bring the patient's injury to be properly dressed and bandaged.

But if the patient has an excessive flow of blood while working, then you cauterize the wound immediately, or pause over it with some powdered substances that restrain the bleeding, and return to your medication until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And bind the injured limb with a suitable ligature, and cure it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	I recommend to you that you seek out a man in his foot, this physician whom I have recommended to you, who is skilled in cases where there is pain in the foot due to pressure or fire-like inflammation.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption is first in the foot, which causes pressure to spread throughout the entire foot.

And then that man prepares himself so that the physician applies pus near the wound in order to increase the heat of the inflammation and pain, and to inflame the foot at the joint, which heals slowly.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time ago, that corruption in the said place of the hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma. E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And the pain makes me want to insert the hand of the patient, and I do not wish to do so expecting the effect of that surplus, and more fearful than afraid, I fear the insertion of the hand of the patient death, because the virtue of the disease was only in the cure.

E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not shared this story but so that it may be an assistant on what is suffered from this disease, and that it be a signification for which it may be understood and according to which it may be performed.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of treatment with sponges and quality of clisterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	Joint pain caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body leads to an abscess in fatty tissues and as it grows, the space within the abscess is prolonged until it's filled with pus, and then it ruptures and perforates, releasing the pus, and leaving a hollowed-out area which resembles a vessel, covered with a subtle cloth-like material, and not subject to further corruption or infection, nor does it press on bones, nerves, or tendons, it is called an abscess.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged and corruption presses on a limb, then it is called an abscess that will not heal.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The treatment of it is that the vessel is sewn completely around as it is rolled up, and more so when it is subtle, making a cloth, and placing comfort that does not stick to the area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri. E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	It is considered that the sinew has grown and its smell is fetid, so when it is inflamed, you should apply an Egyptian medicine with oil, vinegar, and zinacar receiving parts of almonds, which are adjusted in a vessel, and tied up over a fire until the medicine is done and takes effect on the spot of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; then apply the medicine to that sinus, strengthen its opening, and release the medicine into him for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And extract that medicine at the price; and do so for so many days until the sinus is clarified and the odor is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is treated with water of ashes, when this medicine is not present to you; and so you take the ash of vitis, put over it in water; and apply that to him until you confess that the sinus has been cured.

If the illness does not have tolerance for the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then apply that with water and honey, and mix it with zinacar thrice; and apply that with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey it clarifies and cleans, and the wine adheres to the sinus, especially when in the wine there is an excess of stiptic [inflammation] and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	When you do this procedure occasionally and comfort the patient that the sinus is already healed, but it makes a cluster, then it causes the flesh to come out.

It is because you take a drink of defenicine and dissolve that with rose oil, or if you clusterize it with some medicines and drink others that have properties which I have already written in the treatise about fevers.

If the sinus opening is straight in which the tube of the cluster cannot be inserted, then you make it larger by putting a small iron rod little by little, and pause when it is completely covered with a mixture of Egyptian gum or basilicon to enlarge it.

If the opening from which the vein runs is elevated towards the parts above, then you dry it in a pus-filled place where it can run through others, because when the vein is obstructed in the vicinity of the sinus, the flesh grows there.

If it is not possible to sew the sinus into the bone environment, then press the pus according to your will, and afterwards pierce the member with preparation in which you carry out the arm lighterly, following what is on your apparel, and so that no cause of the arm be retained.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take conservative medicines which will be placed on the sinus as desired, so that they extend over linen cloth.

And if the sinus absorbs many days a subtle motion of the arm is indigest, then you will know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and it is the cause of prolonged treatment, then you should adjust by drying out of medicines, and if the medicines are dry in their substance and virtue, they become like poultices defined, when it is adjusted with excess of addition of sugar.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The treated area is covered with a soft cloth.

If the sinew is prolonged and this cure does not heal, then it is wise to know that corruption is in the place of the wound, and you already have inquiry on the bones or on other hard members or joints; therefore, you will treat with fistular cure, as before was said.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Treatment of corns and ingrown toenails by shaving, applying poultices and making incisions on the toe.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	The corn is an abscess that forms under the nail of the big toe or other toes, and if left untreated for too long, it becomes infected with pus. It is either a simple abscess to be cut open, or one that has become corrupted, in which case one must break into it where the corruption seeps through the tendons of the nail, and causes widespread corruption, leading to an odor from the bone, and results in the gangrene of the toe, and its color becomes dark.

The text means: But if the corruption has already pressed into the bone, then how can you inject the bone and extract it, because no time is healing that is in the corrupted bone.

Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But it is said to be a swelling that occurs in the flesh of most healthy men, for the flesh is light there, and light in the bones or light in the nails.

It appears to be saying: And if there is consolidation in the nails of the finger, then you dry that consolidation according to what is prepared and suited for the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	It appears to be saying: From the beginning of diseases, it is veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	It appears to be saying: Vices are veins, and they are varicose veins that are swollen with superfluous melancholic matter which comes out in the joints of the body, and the major accident of them is in the groin, and more so in the groin of travelers, workers, and porters.

It appears to be saying: The section is done in this manner: first, the groin area is bound with a hot water-soaked cloth between when the black pus is settled, that is feculent of the groin, and then tighten the groin of the patient as the purulent pus comes out through the opening at the end of the wound with a bandage, and then dry the vein in one, two, or three sections, and then apply the black pus with the tied hand into it until the pus is evacuated to the desired amount and frequency, and when it has been expelled the nature of the patient's disease is cured.

Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat. De extraccio venae cruris.	Removal of the vein from the leg.

De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	From the section on worms generated under the skin, and it is called cattle illness.

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	The disease is relieved by cutting above.

De extraccio de sagetas.	On the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Joint points are diversified according to their species, and according to the locations of the body in which they occur, because their diversity is that of those who have large points, small points, concave points, and silent points, these are solid; and those with three angles, and those to which they have tongues; and those with tips.

Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the poultice is applied on large pores of tender flesh, then it should be covered not with oil, and perhaps the poultices are washed out with vinegar or vinegar of solatrum, or water of chamomile, or water of calendula, and similar substances.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for one whose humors are of damp moisture, wash the poultices with vinegar or water of myrtle and sumac, similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of that person whose swelling is great, wash their nostrils with vinegar anticy or water from San-succo, which is stronger, or the decoction of anise or chamomile, and to them it seems.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And consider covering the nostrils with cloth; administer it in front of the cloth for an hour or two, and let the person sleep near their swelling.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is necessary to regulate an abscess that will burst due to the bloodletting.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider that if the phlebotomist or one who performs bloodletting has been inflamed and swollen, then consider taking causes of coldness, such as milgranes acetosas, and endiva wine, and juniper, and juice of grapes, and to them it seems.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And place to their food such as pollets, meat of roasted birds, and foods seasoned with salt, and to them it seems.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that person whose complexion is freckled, consider taking in drink Essarp almiiva or essarp of juniper and semences, and sumac, and let it be recommended to them that they use little drinking and eating, and pause their foods of pollets, camabir, pissers, and small birds, and small fowl, like colombat.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of venous constriction and hemorrhoidotomy, the drink should be greater than food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary to give them in drink at certain hours, or to add Tyrian purple, or musk, when they are in pain, or before venous constriction, or after hemorrhoidotomy, so that the main members may be comforted and the sickness subside; and it is not permissible for them to take those scales.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the venous swellings that are due to their scarification are those that stop at the liver, and on the knee, and on the thigh, and around the groin, because those members do not bear scarring themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not for those but for the attraction of a member's sickness, just as when you put a venous stop on the nipple in the case of a bloody flow from the nipple; and use that to dissolve the inflamed venosity which is viscous in the member, just as you put one over the belly and the navel; because that refines the member and scars it, and dissolves the pain which resolves the inflammation.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	It has been stopped on the nodules when it occurs in their opination or pain, because for this reason of strong attraction, the opination is stopped and the pain of its place is eradicated.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, when it is stopped on the liver and spleen, where there is venosity in those enclosed spaces.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These venous humors are administered, as with the suck, alone and only occasionally, with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	Some are administered full of water to quench the fever in the spleen's diseases.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	This is why the venous humors are filled and made great, so they have cold water alone or hot water with suitable herbs added to it.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	The form of the venous humors administered with fire: is the size of the opening twice, according to how it was formed; and the amount of poison is three times the size of a palm; and in the middle of the finger, in the place where it is in the circuit, the size is three times the size of the cut, the needle is small according to the quantity that enters into it an arrow.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	If it is located at the cross of a broken or of iron, then place a candle on fire next to it.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And it is this large, windy needle of the one we have recorded; and the small thread according to diseases and the state of the person who uses that.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the windlasses of children and emaciated people are different from those of young men with thick bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this needle on fire next to the limb is that a small decent log is placed in front of a little candle wax, and then you place that on the cross of the broken bone at the middle location of the wound, so that the fire surrounds the part left, so as not to burn the body of the sick.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And place it on the limb of the sick person, and say so over the wound that they have said, until when you have the windlasses and do not need to show them that they are saying, because then the vapor falls on that wound, and soon the wound is dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	I burn in its place according to my manner, and proceed further if necessary of that.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in a vessel that is administered in the disease of pleasurelessness, with water, where there is no crosswise cutting nor traction, and it is not administered but filled with water, and placed on the member alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: The vessel how much greater it is, so much better, for that it can receive great quantity of water.
