Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered on multiple members but rather on the members where it is impossible to position vessels due to their small size, such as in the mouth and gums or similar, or on a member naked of flesh, such as the tongue and nose or those that are similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those which you have found bloodletting vessels that are in the stagnant waters of putrefying mud.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu. And if the sickness is multiplied, then powder vitriol trissat, or gall, and substances similar to those used for styptic, into the wound; or keep the fingers of flour-cooked fava beans on the affected area until they stick to it, and the wound is closed.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And also, if necessary, iteration of bloodletting, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if bloodletting is prohibited due to suspense, then press the affected area with fresh wound or leave an arrow in those places until the sickness appears again.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	When you want them to stop, sprinkle some powder over those a little coarse-tried, or salt, or ash, and heat it immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Then begins the procedure of treatment: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is often necessary in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, know that the fools of medicine and the common people, and those who do not attend to the books of the Ancients, nor even read one letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And because of this reason, it is made that this science in our land is private; and I have not mentioned it to anyone before now, except when some people ask me for it over a long period of study of the books of the Ancients and a careful understanding of their meaning, as one extracts knowledge from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I will now direct the experiments and studies at my own pace.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have now written down everything in this chapter that contains my science and on which is passed the most important experiment; since after careful consideration, I will release it to you others and free it from occupation of length; and I will abbreviate it at the end of abbreviation; and I will show it at the end of declaration; and I will form there many forms of the supplements that are administered in that, just as is done by addition of declaration, just as I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	The capital word.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A fracture of a bone is to be summarized and collected from those whose release is necessary before we begin to recall the limbs broken and the different parts if any one's.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore let us speak of the summaries of this chapter, and the headings by which they should be understood, inasmuch as the principles are evident to those who know how to work on them, and their truth is clear; so it is you and those like you who are eager to learn this noble art other than your own.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when an accident happens to any fracture, dislocation, twisting, or concussion, then cover yourself with the beginning by flebotomy or applying heat to it, or as needed, if no cause prevents you, because of weakness of virtue, or that which occurs in a child, or due to decay, or during times of great heat, or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And therefore take care in eating seven kinds of dried herbs and fleshes of birds and fish, and prohibit fatty meats and fill them with foods and all the food that fills the veins of the liver, until you are sure of having cauterized an apothem securely, and if you fear a discharge of matter from the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient's malady to its primary condition, as it was customary for him.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the malady be nourished with nutritious food and drink rich in moisture as well as thick ones like those made from wheat water, rice, meat, fish, entrails of cows, pigs, and fresh flesh, and such foods are made thinner coagulation of fracture slightly and more easily.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	It is wise to know that bones break when they are in old men as well as in young ones and in those who are in decay, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature through the drying out of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times by the drying out of those members, just as those that are from them in the end of life, like the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and connects itself over the broken bone from all parts, without any similar cause that causes swelling that adheres to and strengthens what is within that is loose and tied together, as when it comes to the end of strength and firmness, like fire at the beginning, where no cause prohibits its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	It causes pain due to inflammation of the internal parts.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a great diversity in fractures according to the diversity of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	You know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for a fracture in the bone of the thigh is different from a fracture in the bone of the head; and the fracture in the bone of the foot is different from the fracture in the bone of the hand; and similarly all other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I will remember each type of fracture, explained in its own specific chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	A great diversity of fractures is in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	They are diversified the types of bone fractures in their own essence; for a fracture occurs curved somewhere else than at its joints; and some occur according to the length of the bone: and there are the fractures of a straight bone and star-shaped bones and angular fractures proceeding or not from them, just as it is done when writing with a sharp instrument, and it is a fracture of a plague and disruption in the head, and it's a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	Every person has or suffers some kind of pain in restoration according to what will come back as a memory of him in his places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Secret sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And from this it is known that a fracture of the bone is: its twisting and curvature, and its appearance and feeling in the touch, and so when you press upon it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when it is not in the twisted appearance or its sensation is not felt, if you touch upon the bone with movement and your patient does not suffer a great pain, this may not be a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is twisting or small fracture, and then you may not know whether to press upon it with your hand and apply compression of the entire area; sometimes pause over it of the medicines from which you get remembrance about the moment when it convenes to the place; and make it straight by subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	You know that the place when it is curved and not split into two or in such a way that something does not happen there, as soon as you feel the whole part broken from its structure, then you may cover that you begin to correct it starting from your hour towards rectification of it whenever that happens an apostema.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	If there is an apoplexy in him, then let it be laid down for many days before it ceases, and place him on the ground in such a way that you can lift him either by means of lifting or by means of raising.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You know that the restoration of the humors and the cauterization of the patient are lighter than those that occur in the bone where it happens.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And place him so that what will come back to him is his strength.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if there is a fracture in the bone, then it is necessary to extend that broken member, whether it is the arm or the foot; or with your own hand if the limb is small; or with two cords or one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	So position yourself with the hand that holds the broken limb in a position similar to its natural shape, while extending the parts of the limb that are broken, then force yourself so that you make those addictions return again by means and according to how you can do it in their place.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful according to your strength so that it does not happen over the patient during your operation or injury; and force yourself as much as you can that you apply a bone against another bone its companion according to its best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	In that moment you can take advantage of it and touch your hand on the patient's hand, and if sometimes there is a different cause, correct it and tie it up according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Respectfully I refuse to apply extreme extension and compression, as do foolish doctors who use untested methods that have caused swelling by their operation, or caused contraction in the same member as we saw it during their previous operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then connect, provide a correct equilibrium and decent operation, and stable structure of that member, rest and tranquility; advise the patient on this and instruct them to avoid hurting it during their watchfulness and sleep, and observe its reaction and agitation, and do what is necessary for it, and do all its movements with all your virtue; and wait to see if the position of the member is a correct one, which is a position in which the pain is secured, that is why one feels when in the disposition of the position of the member or the injury; sometimes it's possible to change it to another disposition without feeling pain; and guard it well so that the position of him is right and tied, so that the member does not twist when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the tightness of a calm member is that which I recommend, in order to know that broken limbs are diverse in their size and proportion and form.

Another method of dressing stronger for the solution that this first one, when accidents happen due to cauterization requiring restoration of the member: recipe of aloes and sesame seeds, balaustre, melilot, majorana, violet flowers, chamomile, all crushed and mixed together; all are pounded and coated with vinegar or water of sauge or watered down vinegar, all that according to the quality of the member and its rest.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat. Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter On Fractures That Occur in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	There are different kinds of fractures, and their forms are various, and the causes are distinct, because no fracture is caused by a blow to space, and the impact passes through the entire bone into the skull, which leaves the bone in that way as if it had been broken like an axe, or a space penetrates into some part of the bone, and pierces the flesh without passing through the end of it; and this kind of fracture is called a dislocation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures is either great or small, and of the fracture that is constricted or attracted; and its cause is a blow from a heavy stone or a rock onto the bone, which resembles it.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	This fracture or is penetrating that already approaches the panicle which is left the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the wound of these two fractures is large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	This fracture is that it is bruised in the bone, in the subtlety of small hair, and therefore this special type of fracture is called capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	It is a fracture that occurs either by fall or by percussion of the peyra and to it, something enters the bone into the parts, and this occurs in the concavity like accidents to horses when they occur to their percussion and are fractured from their intrusion into the parts.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	It is more likely to occur in human bones of old age, just like the head of a child.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	So are all these types of fractures sagacious, they are like stars separated.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I find the remembrance of everything in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And it knows all these types of fractures by detection for those and by inquiry about their bone and flesh, which is corrupt.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	There is a special type of capillary that occurs in this case where the bone is exposed, it is cleaned and bound with thread, and it is covered with linen to prevent further bleeding.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fractures, consideration is given to the initial symptoms of illness, and thus if you multiply by the symptoms that signify something manifest over fear, such as vomiting due to anger, stretching, loss of understanding, abstinence from speech, convulsions, acute fever, and swelling of limbs and a red rash similar to those in major dispositions, it is not considered healing.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	If you sometimes have symptoms that are not correct, then you hope for recovery, and thus you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	Which cause is that if it has come to you with the plague in the early stages, as it was the injury and also in the days of winter, thus because you study on the bone beneath the day 14 according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, thus you cover that you collect or remove the bone beneath the 7th day, because so that the bone is corrupted by pan-niculous (likely a reference to putrefaction), and that accidents occur as previously recommended.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	If the fracture has already reached the panniculus cover the brain, and is small in size and tender, then cover that comminuted part with a minuted incision, as I will recommend to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	It is for this reason that you must rate the head of the patient, and discover over the bones according to custom and manner, in order to make it lighter on the disease.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	If it happens to you that the detection of the bone, flowing of the suture or apostema caut, then you must oppose it to him and do not touch, because you fill the place with moist cloths in wine and rose oil, and let the wound rest until the apostema is sedated, and you are sure of the flow of the suture; and from there you begin in the circumference of the bone and in the ablation of it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one manner is that you incise the bone with an incisor of straight cut, this is how it is done: Take another incisor of straight cut, not much softer than that, and do this.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Return the instruments of more powerful application than what has been used so far.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	It is necessary for you to know the names of various cutters, from which some have greater sharpness than others; and those with greater sharpness are shorter than others, and are of iron or flint.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	Use their ease in percussion on the cutters, so that you do not hit your head and damage it.

But the stricture of the bone when it is these wounds and sections, is that you put plaster made of flour of mill and album of egg upon it, and then stop over it a thread, and place again the spear so that it does not touch the titillating of him, if necessary, and take humemate, such as the Torquemada, which was very long, and its latitude of it was one palm or close to it; and you put powder double upon the stop and the plaster; and then take a table stake so fine that its latitude is three times and in length similar; and then wrap up this stick with cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the stick on the place over the break; and then stop humemate as he revout, and revolve it over the neck of him and the titillating of him healthy, and reduce it altogether, and when the stricture of the fracture is finished, and it is not concealed upon you.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of the fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken at the inner side of him, and not at him, but only at the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	When the location of the limb is broken and it is broken in the middle part of the limb and nothing can be seen except by touch, then follow as the shape of the fracture forces you to prepare the preparation and reduce it according to the natural figure in every manner that it is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc. Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the poultice is concave in about one-third of the area where the spoon lies, then you cover that concavity with a cloth and apply pressure to stop the bleeding, and place another poultice according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And tie strongly above with linen bandage around the swollen tongue due to a sufficient constriction, and fasten the poultice firmly within where it is not yet retracted from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the bandage every day; and whenever it becomes soft, tie it again and strengthen it, if it is retracted from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	The patient's malady is placed on his left side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The lancet or spate (spatula) is restored in XX days or XXV (25).

Capitol .vii.	Cap. VII (Chapter VII).
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the Restoration of Fractures of the Foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot sometimes breaks at the middle part of it and is torn apart; but the extremities of it are more torn than crushed or minced.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And when of the accidents that break it, when the middle part is fractured, then it falls into the parts and there comes great pain to it, and difficulty in breathing, coughing, a severe fever, and vomiting; and it is declared in its cavity in the broken bone and is not hidden from the sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela. Go along the chain according to some sort of stretch on the back sometimes, and strengthen that with strictness necessary; and consider the chain throughout the time, and when softened tighten that one.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	If it is necessary to provoke the removal of that (the plaster), either because of corrosion or swelling, or pain, or an abscess that occurs in the place, then take out and remove that carefully, and eradicate the plaster and correct what happens as a result by some method of cure for him; and return the plaster if needed at times to the face; and adjust his structure until he is cured.
Capitol .viii.	Capital chapter eight.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On restoring of the backs when they are compressed.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You should know that a fracture of the back is not in the bone itself, but rather in the large joints where two bones meet; and from their extremities towards the head, those big breaks do not occur, unless it is through the articulations containing cartilages.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And it should be known that this is not hidden under the symptoms of the disease; for the inquiry into the disease involves these expressions.

And the restoration is to equal the fracture according to the possible manner, in such a way that it is filled with some substance according to what is deemed suitable, and to apply plaster and strength to the broken bone at that point, if necessary.

And from what they say, that the covering which presses down on the patient's stomach, causing inflammation and windiness, so that the belly is inflated and expanded, and the fracture is driven towards the outer parts.

E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	They said that the wind should be stopped and the strength applied to it; and this is like a rational reasoning, but however, it is feared that the wind will inflate the superfluities even further because of weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	They said that the area should be covered with wool that is already submerged in hot oil, and small powders should be placed between the ribs while it is being filled, so that the wound may heal again when you turn over on your back; and they should treat the patient with a cure of pleurisy using meat and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	If the illness is causing violent constriction, and the flesh pokes through with a pointed wound, we fear for the patient, then cover that place, because it seems that they must break open the cracked bone, and put over that instrument which preserves the ciphac, whose memory is preceded, and which inscribes the bones with ease, and extract that.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	Let us adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with cauterization, and heal it with plaster inside until it heals.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	If it happens to form an abscess, then you put your finger and press powder into olive oil on the spot, and cover that with what prevents the abscess from forming.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	Let him lie on the side on which he sleeps, until he heals.

De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of a broken vertebra in the spine and the neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Fractures of some bones in the neck and some fractures at their articulations, and similar fractures in the spine.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	When this occurs in one person and they wish to know if they will recover or not, consider it, because if you feel your joints softened and stunned, and dead and cannot measure or strengthen them, and when you constrict those with your fingers or prick those with a needle, and do not feel pain in those areas, then you know that it is not recovery, but especially in the months of disposition it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	But if you feel pain in those constricted areas with your fingers and the puncture, then you know that the neck of the bone is saved and that the illness will recover by treatment.

The translation is: But if the bone is broken, and it's the end of the cut, then cover that you insert the tip of your right hand into the wound and equalize the broken bone with the other hand, as possible by equating second; and place a bandage over him with plaster and stapes, if necessary, and bind tightly.

De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the restoration of the width.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura. Capitol .xi.	The End.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the assistant.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjurator is that which is between the wrist and at the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	If it is broken, then the restoration of him is in one of two ways, of which one is that you take an iron bar of half an inch thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And they are tied in two extremities with ligaments, and it is suspended from the raised place.

E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the ulcer is lifted over his neck and his hand is placed on his neck with ligaments; and he commands two ministers that one of them holds it above the fracture with his hands; and the other puts behind him; and whichever of them extends to his part.

If you want the extension to be stronger, then strengthen on the fracture with ligaments and another ligament, and whichever of the two ministers extends them to both sides.

Therefore if the fracture is close to the end of the muscle tendon, then cover half the ligament on the citylic and the other leaves the fracture to be held by the joint.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Similarly if the fracture is close to the joint, then cover the ligament on that location and on that joint.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	So that it is made easy and its work, and then place the amount as far as it is covered, whenever it is applied with good application, otherwise strengthen that if an apoplexy occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if an apoplexy occurs, then release the strengthening within seven days, and place over it wool saturated with vinegar and rose oil until the apoplexy is paused, and then strengthen that.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	The method of strengthening that is to apply plaster over the fracture, and then wrap with a napkin of cloth on the plaster; and adjust the arm above the assistant, and place your hand open on your own muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	There is something broken in the bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And afterwards, use needles.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And that one is placed over the fracture of the needle that is put more in and more strong than the others; and pauses between each needle the latitude of the finger, and the length of the needles according to the break with the addition of three words from the entire injury.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And holds tight over the needles according to the structure which I have said at the beginning of this chapter.

Capitol .xii.	Book twelve.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of a broken arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones, which are called "forks"; one small, and it is the one that bears the foot, and the other large, which holds the small one below from the beginning upwards.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And if the larger fork is easily broken, or the smaller one, and both are easily fractured.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small fork is broken below, then the restoration of it is lighter, and the healing of it is even lighter.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the larger fork is broken below the fracture of it is bad, and the healing of it is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse still when both bones are broken at the same time.

Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On the cause of dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation occurs when one of the joints in the body is injured, and therefore it must be prohibited from movement, and the figure of the limb is twisted, and brings over the patient intense pain and large injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, one must promptly attempt to reduce it, and not delay in doing so, because if it is delayed, the joint becomes swollen and strong with this, and it is done difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And so it is not necessary to be swollen or extended in the hour of the operation, because many times we have seen that spasms and pains arise afterwards.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When such accidents happen, it is necessary to get back into the bowels of the disease, and so place the opening in such a way that you pause the swelling; and so the member should be bound with hot water and oil, and so it should be reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the whole member will be healed with that of which the memory comes back to its place.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	The treatment of joint dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some cases are dislocated at all joints.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger is dislocated at the two knuckles of the palm or in the belly of the hand, then straighten it and push the dislocation back with both hands, until you return.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And fix the head of the finger, and suspend that weight on the part to which it is dislocated, and let it rest for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And suspend that one and extend the other until three days have passed in which it is fixed.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is not good, apply that secondly according to the same method, and do not cease to untie that in the day and exercise with movement, and apply that there for several days until it is straight.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	It means: On the treatment of dislocation of the spine's joints.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute. It means: And this is where the evacuation of the disease is outside of one's will, and cannot be held back; and sometimes it softens some parts of the body or both legs or two arms or one of those. It means: But the treatment of it is that one considers whether the gelbozitation occurs in childhood, because in that case there is neither cure nor healing from it.

Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.

E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	It cannot be cured in itself, but rather the one that occurs in the two joints at this point which you recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu. E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And place a cloth over the head of the malady and tie them with thread tightly; extend the extremity of the thread to the stick which is due to his head, and tie that one to him; and tie the other thread over the legs of him, under the knees of him, and for his bed; and adjust all the threads and tie those in the other stick which is due to his feet.

When applying the minister to each extended limb at the beginning of the garment, and not re-tightening both garments and the ligatures at the places where they are attached, but nonetheless not leaving them loose as previously stated.

De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of treatment for dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not suffer only from dislocation, but also from other joints with small movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	The joint of the wide hip is displaced in four ways: it is displaced to the left side or to the right side, or to the front or back side.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	It is more frequently displaced to the left side and less so to the front or back sides.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The symptoms of displacement to the left side are that when you adjust the bedpost in a healthy manner, the pain becomes longer and deeper than before, and the person cannot bend their knee because it is swollen with pus, and this is the location where the swelling has become so severe that the tongue is swollen with an ulcer.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The symptom of the person who experiences displacement is to the front, because the accidents that occur in him are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The symptom of the person who experiences displacement to the front is that the knee expands according to a degree, but yet again, there is no bending of that joint which causes pain, and if it penetrates further towards that area, he cannot put pressure on those parts; and his urine is retained and his perineum is swollen with an ulcer, so he must be ambulated over the ankle.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	When a dislocation occurs in the parts behind is that the person does not expand the joint, nor can they bend it so that it gets stuck again, and the cushion is shorter than the other, and the bending is softened, and the head of the hernia is located at that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	Most reductions of this dislocation are that you consider, meanwhile, if the dislocation is old and ancient, it is already decayed and will not be improved by your treatment, meanwhile not all; and therefore it cannot be done a reconstruction.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the one where the dislocation is recent and it's one of the four kinds of dislocation, meanwhile you must apply to this that you will return the joint and extend it to both parts inside and outside, and then also to the right and left, as soon as possible, without needing any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this manner, meanwhile you can cover that you prepare a strong minister and extend the hernia of the part more to the left, or with your hands, or with ligament which is tied over the joint; and another minister extends his hand on that side so as to put your hand closer to the titillations of him; and place strong ligament on the base of the hernia, and keep another minister to tie the extremity of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	The area of tension or from the beginning to the point where the flexor muscle ends, or from behind the point where the tricep muscle begins.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	The area of all those in one place where the patient lies on his side and remains still.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This type of expansion is common to all four limbs.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	Therefore if the dislocation returns to where we said it would, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to tell all about that type of treatment for its own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of his own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is at the joints, so that the patient lies on his back side; and place the ligaments over the line of the cistern in that location where the head of the cistern meets the area left after the incision.

E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient should be suspended over the head of the chest, and in the middle; and its length equal to two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat. Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the reduction itself, when it is a dislocation at the outward part, cover that the patient jogs over a peg according to what has been recorded by him who has geloziated; and strengthen the tie on the diseased chamber precisely and on the foot of him.

When two sticks are placed on them, one under the feet and the other under the head; and the sticks are placed so that they fit snugly over the top of the stone where wet cloths are wrapped around it, to prevent the disease from being aggravated by having the stick between their thighs, in order that the width of the area should not be compressed.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	Let anyone who is willing extend his hand, and the doctor has his hand wrapped around the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if the patient follows instructions, it will work well; but if not, to pause carefully over that spot and see what they said about that binding in their book of remedies.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	May it also be the case that the disease worsens on its own in those who do not follow their treatment.

When a dislocation is in the front parts of the body, it is considered that the covering should be stretched slightly, and it follows this way according to the road; and the doctor places his right palm on the swollen area, and takes up the other hand, and binds that extension to the back parts of the left side at the end of the disease.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre. So, with the reduction completed as you should - and don't hide from the sign of the reduction of him, for it is that you extend the malady over two limbs, and when you pull those bands and the malady extends its limb and expands those excisions, then you will see if the member returns according to how it should be returned; and therefore you adjust two cushions and place a band on top so that the width is not swollen in any of the parts; and attach the malady to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Remove the bandages and dressings, and compare one to another.

De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the cure of joint dislocation of the elbow.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The elbow is dislocated in three ways: when it is displaced outward, inward, and more so to the rear than to the front, and not at all in front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	When a joint is dislocated, it means that you command the patient to place their cushion in the cavity; afterwards, you will see that the pain is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	The restoration of all the limbs is that you cause the patient to cut open their wound, afterwards, if possible, make them extend their cushion; attach your two hands to the face of the patient, and place the hand of the patient between your feet; and also attach the pain of the patient to your palms, and hold those between your fingers on the pain of the patient with strength; and another minister extends the foot of the patient until the pain returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The sign of redemption is that the cushion adheres to the cavity without labor or effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And place that one, and attach the cushion to the cavity, and afterwards tie those together with a band for three days or four, and then release them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the sick person for walking for more than a few days, until they are healed and recovered.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	The text means: But if the reduction of the thing to you is exempted, then administer strong extension and lamentation for the ones in the healing of the preceding joint narration.
Capitol .xxxiii.	The text means: Chapter thirty-three.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	The text means: On the healing of the ankle displacement.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The text means: The ankle sometimes is mended with small movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to the complement, and the dislocation of it is done either in the divisions of the tendons or in the divisions outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	The text means: And the sign of the ankle's dislocation is that whenever the ankle inflates before it reaches the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The text means: But the healing of the small movement is of light return, and it is that he be extended with ease by the hands and be enclosed within when he returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	The text means: But in the healing of it when it is dislocated according to the complement, if you cut the diseased part right, and hold that one a strong and brave minister at the back of the two behind him in the middle place of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And now place your right hand on the highest point of the foot and your left hand on the lower part of the foot in the hole's location.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Now lift the foot with your right hand and pull it with your left hand twice, stretch your left arm, and press the foot's toe towards the work of the cushion.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Do this twice as you have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Press the foot's toe into the cushion for the third time and you will be in the hole.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	If you return to one side or go back and forth for this way, and if the foot gets stuck, then it is good; otherwise, you must iterate the operation, because that returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if it is forbidden to reduce the one there that you have counted, then place the patient on their back over solid earth, and stretch a pallet made of fabric on solid ground, so that it will lie between the thighs, and you already have covered them with a cloth to prevent the patient from becoming loose.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Here is the guessed translation:
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	The doctor puts back the dislocation with his hands, and another minister takes care of healing the cavity in those parts, because the dislocation returns to its ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you that the reduction of the limb has been done, then pause with plaster and wrap it tightly in bandages, and tie the foot to the bed.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	Be careful not to bind too tightly those nerves that are behind the ankle, lest they be compressed and harmed.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And let it [the plaster] loosen for two days or three, and if the binding is soft, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And remove that plaster on the fourth day or fifth, and forbid the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he must go in front of that space, it is not safe that the dislocation may not be dissolved and corrupted, and therefore it should be avoided.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	But if it happens to him an apostema [infection], then be careful that you administer in the cicatrization of him there in which our narrative began, at another place of cure and embrocation, until he is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter one, fourth.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Treatment of dislocation of the toes of the foot.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	How that man who is dislocated should be laid down in a little extension of his limbs; and this if it is not difficult, then it is lighter.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in the big toe of the foot, as is often the case, cover that the swelling of the leg be put on its side over the earth or on a table, and let it rest in such a way as if it had gone.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And place your foot on the ground where the joints are, and put calcaneum upon that under the arch of your foot until you return, so that you see it already laid out and not come up to the prominence.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place the patient's belly of the foot on a table that takes up the entire foot, which has two caps, and strongly bind that part with a stretchy structure for three days; and then remove it and have it rest in walking position for a few days, until it is stretched and its firmness is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	The end of Chapter XXXV.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Dislocations due to injury or fracture or any kind of fracture.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes happen and you pierce yourself while treating the wound or restoring it, often this happens leading to death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And so it is not safe to assume that you will recover from the wound unless he who is wise in this art takes counsel, uses long experience, mercy, and pity, delaying nothing, daring neither too quickly nor too slowly; using only poultices for the beginning of medicines, and assuring the diagnosis with divine judgment, rather than relying on it alone, and more, placing hope for salvation from death, alleviation from illness, and in which there appears any chance.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then it is forced to do him so much sooner in the beginning of the cause, using cauterization.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the limb returns according to what you wish, he administers a regimen that allows cauterization and cures the wound with what is appropriate for him of antiseptic.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	If dislocation occurs due to fracture and an accident happens in the separated bones, then you must perform the statement of their position, and do what has been said for simple illnesses of this kind that have preceded them in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Guard and avoid according to your judgment the instrument in the channels of fear as it is preceded by my preaching; for this is better for you than if I had not spoken to you, and more pleasing to your Creator, and more enduring to your glory, and more salutations to your true body those which are yours in truth in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Assuringly finish the words of Albucasis perfectly as those are not favored by God.
Amen.	Amen.
